intro: Scaevola sieberi, commonly known as the blue scallop flower, is a perennial shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bilaterally symmetrical blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Scaevola sieberi is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
